entry.title: Domestic football nearly back, not long now!
entry.summary:
Photo by Paul Devlin/SNS Group via Getty Images
Ahead of the return of a famous sporting organisation getting ready for THE REAL STUFF on Sunday, we thought we’d take a look back and share some season openers over the years. But enough about GIGPOD, Celtic are also going to be kicking a ball. With the actual football just around the corner, here’s a few curtain raisers we’ve enjoyed over the years, either at Celtic Park, or away from home! We start with a classic at Tannadice in 1991. Dundee Utd 3-4 Celtic, featuring two absolute screamers from John Collins!
Sunday’s opponents were also involved in a memorable 2-2 draw back in August 1996. This was a game that I went to in an era when I missed no away games, but to this day, it’s one of only three games I have left before the 90 minutes are up, and indeed I never witnessed Thom’s leveller below.
Does it get any better than the win at Tannadice in 2000, for what was the first game of the MON era though?
A decade of opening day dominance after that, generally, other than the occasional away day draw, including this disasterclass in 2005 against Motherwell at Fir Park!
We all remember Patrick McCourt’s virtuoso effort at Inverness in 2010 surely?
Fast forward six years later, Tynecastle 2016. Scott Sinclair’s late winner starts the invincible run under Brendan Rodgers
And while the Neil Lennon regime was hardly inspirational, there was of course the fantastic 7-0 thumping of St Johnstone back in 2019!
Let’s hope for more of the same this weekend! Here’s some trivia to leave you very confident for the game ahead:
Trawled through records to find out when was the last time we lost a game at Celtic Park on the opening day of the season and it seems to have been; 9th Sep 1950 - Celtic 3-4 Morton. Pub quiz obsessives, you’re welcome!— Stevie ⚪️ (@stevieblock102) July 26, 2022

entry.title: Reaction to Celtic 2-0 Norwich // Michael Johnston rumours
entry.summary:
Photo by Mikolaj Barbanell/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images
Yesterday was, thankfully, the last pre season game we’ll be involved in before regular blogs during the season that will be 22-23, and it’s Aberdeen at Celtic Park next weekend. At long last. If you missed Daizen Maeda and David Turnbull putting Norwich to the sword, as well as the general highlights, here they are below:
Reaction to the comfortable victory was covered on 67HH too!
Earlier tonight, we had rumours (and that’s all they are) developing regarding Michael Johnston being SHIPPED OUT on loan to Ronald Deila’s Standard Liege.
Rumours Mikey Johnston off to @Standard_RSCL on loan.— Celticunderground (@celticrumours) July 24, 2022
Would definitely be the best thing for his career, and well within Celtic’s interests to see him getting regular games at another club, so hopefully this isn’t yet another lie from a Twitter account and it actually has a bit of weight to it in the coming days.
